metadata.synopsis:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

15.speaker: Scratch
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog sniffs his owner's corpse

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *The dog flashes its teeth in a snarl - he wants you gone.*
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog sniffs his owner's corpse

24.speaker: Scratch
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog sniffs his owner's corpse

30.speaker: Scratch
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog sniffs his owner's corpse

50.speaker: Player
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snarling, turning to the player

31.speaker: Player
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snarling, turning to the player

40.speaker: Scratch
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snarling, turning to the player

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You're Scratch, aren't you? Come here. It's all right.

69.speaker: Scratch
69.text: You know my name? Interesting - a predator wouldn't care to learn it.

19.speaker: Scratch
19.text: What are you doing? Get back!

127.text: What are you doing? Get back!

11.speaker: Scratch
11.text: What are you doing? Get back!

106.speaker: Player
106.text: If I wanted to hurt either of you, I'd have done it already.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I could snap you in half, if I wanted to. I don't.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: You don't want me angry. Trust me - one animal to another.

72.speaker: Scratch
72.text: Perhaps that's true. Your scent is thick with blood.

39.speaker: Scratch
39.text: Perhaps that's true. Your scent is thick with blood.

29.speaker: Scratch
29.text: Still, you should go. My friend is injured. He needs rest.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I don't think he's going to wake up.

80.speaker: Scratch
80.text: Of course he will. And then we'll return home.

98.speaker: Scratch
98.text: He calls me Scratch. You can do the same.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: What happened to your friend, exactly?

111.speaker: Scratch
111.text: We were attacked. Cackling, furry things on two legs.

86.speaker: Scratch
86.text: And their smell... it was strange. Rotten. Evil.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: *You know the creatures he describes - gnolls.*

49.text: *You know the creatures he describes - gnolls.*

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *You know the creatures he describes - gnolls.*

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Come on, you can travel with me if you like.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: If he doesn't wake up, follow my scent. I have a camp.

97.speaker: Scratch
97.text: If it comes to that... I may. Thank you.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Prove the man is dead - shout at his corpse.

16.speaker: Scratch
16.text: Just go. I won't ask you again.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: It's noble to protect one of your clan, but he's gone.

68.speaker: Scratch
68.text: He's not my clan. He's my friend.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Stop deluding yourself - you are guarding a corpse.

37.speaker: Scratch
37.text: Your words are uglier than the rest of you.

55.speaker: Scratch
55.text: Go back to whatever hole you slithered out of.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: He's with his god now. I'm sorry.

28.speaker: Scratch
28.text: It's not over yet. He'll wake up.

27.text: You snarl, but you have no teeth.

54.speaker: Scratch
54.text: You snarl, but you have no teeth.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm not an enemy, I promise.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Calm, friend. I mean you no harm.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I understand your fear, but I promise I mean you no harm.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Calm yourself. I harm only those deserving of it.

108.speaker: Scratch
108.text: Hm. There's death in your scent, but not in your words.

62.speaker: Scratch
62.text: Hm. There's death in your scent, but not in your words.

10.text: These wilds crawl with monsters. You could be one of them.

6.speaker: Scratch
6.text: These wilds crawl with monsters. You could be one of them.

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *The dog remains at the dead man's side, as if in mourning.*
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

60.speaker: Scratch
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

78.speaker: Scratch
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *The dog watches the corpse, a quiet whine escaping with every breath.*
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

95.speaker: Scratch
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

53.speaker: Player
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Sidestep him to get to the corpse.
122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

20.speaker: Player
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

51.speaker: Scratch
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

52.speaker: Player
52.text: It's all right, Scratch. I'm not going to hurt you.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog tilts its head/shows uncertainty.

118.speaker: Player
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog tilts its head/shows uncertainty.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *The dog lowers his hackles, his head tilted inquisitively.*
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog tilts its head/shows uncertainty.

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *The dog lowers his hackles, his head tilted inquisitively.*
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog tilts its head/shows uncertainty.

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *Convinced that you're harmless, he turns his attention back to the corpse.*
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, barks. The corpse is clearly dead.

45.speaker: Player
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog bows its head.

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *With a deep, heartbroken whine, the dog bows his head.*
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog bows its head.

76.speaker: Player
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, whining. The corpse is clearly dead.

12.speaker: Player
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, whining. The corpse is clearly dead.

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *The dog looks at his owner with sad eyes. He does not move.*
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, whining. The corpse is clearly dead.

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *He whines, but remains rooted by the corpse's side.*
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, whining. The corpse is clearly dead.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Hold out your hand so he can follow your scent to camp.

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *The dog sniffs your hand, his tail swung low in understanding. He knows how to find you.*

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Take a closer look at him.
92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer look at the dog's neck (collar/tag doesn't necessarily have to be legible when combined with the narration)

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Around his neck is a collar, etched with a name - 'Scratch'.*
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer look at the dog's neck (collar/tag doesn't necessarily have to be legible when combined with the narration)

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Shake your head - the man is gone.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog lets the player pet him (or steps closer into imply this is happening)

57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at the corpse.NodeContext: Dog whining.

99.speaker: Scratch
99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at the corpse.NodeContext: Dog whining.

56.speaker: Scratch
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at the corpse.NodeContext: Dog whining.

1.speaker: Scratch
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns and yaps at the corpse, as if to try to wake it.

101.speaker: Scratch
101.text: Go on. If he doesn't wake... I'll find you.
